alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:27PM CDT until July 14 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN JEFFERSON...SHAWNEE...DOUGLAS...EAST CENTRAL WABAUNSEE AND NORTHERN OSAGE COUNTIES... At 226 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over northwestern Topeka, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters estimated 75 mph winds near Silver Lake at 220 pm CDT. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Lawrence, Baldwin City, Carbondale, Rossville, Tecumseh, Eudora, Richland, Dover, Silver Lake, Auburn, Overbrook, Perry, Scranton, Lecompton, Maple Hill, Clinton, Lone Star, Willard and Pleasant Grove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 340 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 160 and 205. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
